meanings.definition: Moving or capable of moving quickly
meanings.sent1: The cheetah is one of the swifter animals in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The hare is known for being swifter than the tortoise.
meanings.sent3: The swifter wind blew away the hat of the unsuspecting man.
meanings.sent4: Her swifter reflexes allowed her to catch the falling glass before it shattered.
meanings.sent5: The swifter river currents carried the raft downstream at a rapid pace.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that moves quickly
meanings.sent1: The gazelle is a swifter than the elephant.
meanings.sent2: The messenger was a swifter, delivering news across the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The swifter dart won the race against the slower arrow.
meanings.sent4: The swifter of the two cars reached the finish line first.
meanings.sent5: The swifter of the two messengers arrived at the castle with the urgent message.

meanings.definition: More swift or quick than something else
meanings.sent1: The swifter runner won the race by a large margin.
meanings.sent2: Her swifter decision-making skills helped her in times of crisis.
meanings.sent3: The swifter horse outpaced all the others in the race.
meanings.sent4: The swifter response to the emergency saved many lives.
meanings.sent5: The swifter student finished the test before anyone else in the class.
